FuncDef:
The set priority ipv6 dscp command sets a priority for IPv6 protocol packets.
The undo set priority ipv6 dscp command deletes the priority of IPv6 protocol packets. The set priority ipv6 dscp command sets a priority for IPv6 protocol packets. The undo set priority ipv6 dscp command deletes the priority of IPv6 protocol packets. By default, the DSCP value is not configured for protocol packets. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the DSCP value of protocol packets. A larger value indicates a higher priority.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.

ExtraInfo: Generally, each protocol has a default DSCP value. You can run this command to change the DSCP value of host protocol packets.
